intro: Bistorta griersonii, commonly known as the alpine bistorta, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and flowering structures. The plant features thick, rhizomatous stems that help it survive in harsh, cold environments. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, providing insulation against freezing temperatures. Bistorta griersonii produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers during the summer months, contributing to its ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
